itinerary.day1: Morning: Mughal Grandeur & Sunrise Spectacle (6:00 AM – 1:00 PM)
itinerary.day2: Day 1: (As per the 1-Day Plan)
itinerary.day3: Day 1: (As per the 2-Day Plan)

itinerary.day1: Transportation: From Agra Cantt, Taj Mahal is approx. 5.5 km (Auto: ₹125-150, Cab: ₹160-180). From Sadar Bazaar, approx. 4.5 km (Auto: ₹105-130, Cab: ₹120-160).
Enjoy a local breakfast. You can find good options near the East Gate or in Tajganj.
itinerary.day3: Tomb of Akbar the Great (Sikandra), Mariam’s Tomb, Chini Ka Rauza

itinerary.day1: Recommendation: Try Deviram Sweets for Bedai with Aloo Sabzi (₹30) and Jalebi (₹25/100g), or a local joint for hot parathas.
itinerary.day2: Morning: Royal Tombs & Gardens (8:00 AM – 1:00 PM)
itinerary.day3: Ram Bagh, Local Market & Street Food Tour

itinerary.day1: 9:30 AM – 10:00 AM: Travel to Mehtab Bagh
itinerary.day3: Dayalbagh, Roman Catholic Cemetery / Mankameshwar Temple

itinerary.day1: 10:00 AM – 11:30 AM: Mehtab Bagh
itinerary.day2: Essentials: Wear comfortable shoes for walking around the vast complex. Closed on Fridays.
itinerary.day3: Day 3: Historical City Outing or Wildlife Excursion (Lesser priority / Further out)

itinerary.day1: Essentials: Carry water, wear comfortable shoes.
itinerary.day2: Transportation: From Sadar Bazaar, Sikandra is approx. 8-10 km (Cab: ~₹200-300).
itinerary.day3: Morning: UNESCO Heritage Site or Bird Sanctuary (8:00 AM – 1:00 PM)

itinerary.day1: Essentials: Wear comfortable walking shoes. Consider hiring a government-approved guide for historical insights. Closed on Fridays.
itinerary.day2: 10:30 AM – 11:30 AM: Ram Bagh
itinerary.day3: Transportation: From Agra Fort, Fatehpur Sikri is approx. 40 km (Cab: ₹700-800). From Taj Mahal, approx. 45 km (Cab: ₹750-850). Auto/Bike not recommended for this distance.

itinerary.day1: Transportation: From Mehtab Bagh, Agra Fort is approx. 3-4 km (Auto: ₹110-130, Cab: ₹130-160, Bike: ₹40-60).
itinerary.day2: Fees: ₹25 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners).
itinerary.day3: Transportation: From Agra Fort, Keoladeo is approx. 57 km (Cab: ₹690-750). From Taj Mahal, approx. 60 km (Cab: ₹730-800). Auto/Bike not recommended.

itinerary.day1: 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM: Lunch
itinerary.day2: Immerse yourself in the local life by exploring bustling markets like Sadar Bazaar or Kinari Bazaar.
itinerary.day3: Explore this magnificent abandoned Mughal capital. Key attractions include the Buland Darwaza, Jama Masjid, Tomb of Sheikh Salim Chishti, and various palaces.

itinerary.day1: Transportation: From Agra Fort, Itmad-ud-Daulah is approx. 3 km (Auto: ~₹70-100, Cab: ~₹80-120).
itinerary.day2: Afternoon: Offbeat & Reflection (1:00 PM – 6:00 PM)
itinerary.day3: Essentials: Best visited in winter (Nov-Feb). Carry water, wear comfortable walking shoes. Prefer a guide for accurate information. Be back before dark; stay aware of wild animals; do not litter.

itinerary.day1: 5:00 PM – 6:00 PM: Leisure / Hotel Check-in / Relax
itinerary.day2: Option A (History/Serenity): Explore the historical Roman Catholic Cemetery, one of the oldest Christian cemeteries in India, offering a glimpse into colonial history.
itinerary.day3: Essentials: Follow local rules; modest dress code; remove shoes at temple.

itinerary.day1: 6:00 PM – 7:30 PM: "Mohabbat-e-Taj" Light & Sound Show
itinerary.day2: Fees: FREE for both.
itinerary.day3: Essentials: Wear sturdy shoes; modest dress code.

itinerary.day1: Essentials: Book tickets online in advance. Shows are available in English & Hindi.
itinerary.day2: Evening: Dinner & Relaxation (6:00 PM onwards)
itinerary.day3: Option A (Spiritual/Historical): Continue from Bateshwar to Mathura/Vrindavan (approx. 60 km from Agra Fort). Explore temples dedicated to Lord Krishna.

itinerary.day1: Recommendation: Pinch of Spice or Taj Mahal Restaurant for Mughlai cuisine. For street food exploration, head to Chaat Gali, Sadar Bazaar (opens from 5 PM, try Bhalla, Aloo Tikki).
itinerary.day3: Option B (Cultural/Rural): Visit Korai Village for a unique cultural and rural experience. Interact with locals and learn about their way of life.
Evening: Departure or Leisure (6:00 PM onwards)
Hotel Recommendation (Budget): Hotel Royal Phoenix (~₹1,284-₹2,019/night) or Joey's Hostel Agra (~₹401-₹2,189/night).

itinerary.day1: Start your day with the breathtaking beauty of the Taj Mahal as the sun rises, casting a golden glow on the marble. This early start helps avoid crowds and capture stunning photographs.
itinerary.day2: Agra Fort
itinerary.day3: Agra Fort

itinerary.day1: Essentials: Reach East Gate before sunrise to secure tickets and a good spot. Wear comfortable shoes. Avoid Fridays as Taj Mahal is closed.
itinerary.day2: Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb (Baby Taj)
itinerary.day3: Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb (Baby Taj)

itinerary.day1: Head to Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site that served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors. Explore its palaces, halls, and courtyards.
itinerary.day2: Fees: Mariam's Tomb: ₹25 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners); Chini Ka Rauza: FREE.
itinerary.day3: Option A (Historical City): Travel to Fatehpur Sikri. It's about 40 km from Agra.

itinerary.day1: Afternoon: Itmad-ud-Daulah & Local Flavors (1:00 PM – 5:00 PM)
itinerary.day2: 11:30 AM – 1:00 PM: Local Market & Street Food Tour
itinerary.day3: Option A: Fatehpur Sikri

itinerary.day1: Fees: ₹30 (Indians), ₹310 (Foreigners). On Fridays, ₹25 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners).
itinerary.day2: 2:00 PM – 3:30 PM: Dayalbagh (Radhasoami Memorial Complex)
itinerary.day3: Afternoon: Spiritual Journey or Local Village Experience (1:00 PM – 6:00 PM)

itinerary.day2: Transportation: From Sadar Bazaar to Dayalbagh, approx. 8-9 km.
itinerary.day3: 2:00 PM – 3:30 PM: Travel Back / Continue Exploration

itinerary.day1: Evening: Cultural Immersion & Leisure (5:00 PM – 8:00 PM)
itinerary.day2: 3:30 PM – 5:00 PM: Roman Catholic Cemetery (Padre ka Bagh) / Mankameshwar Temple
itinerary.day3: If at Fatehpur Sikri: Travel to Bateshwar Temples (approx. 30 km from Fatehpur Sikri, or 78 km from Agra Fort). These are ancient Hindu temples along the Yamuna.

itinerary.day1: Hotel Recommendation (Mid-Range): Courtyard By Marriott (~₹3,600-₹4,500/night) or Radisson Hotel Agra (~₹4,793-₹9,826/night) for good facilities.
itinerary.day2: Essentials: For temples, remove shoes and dress modestly.
itinerary.day3: If at Keoladeo National Park: Travel to Lohagarh Fort in Bharatpur (approx. 3-4 km from Keoladeo). This 18th-century fort is known for its formidable design.

itinerary.day1: Fees: ₹50 (Indians), ₹1100 (Foreigners); additional ₹200 for Mausoleum entry.
itinerary.day2: Shopping, Cultural Show & Dinner.
itinerary.day3: Shopping, Cultural Show & Dinner.

itinerary.day1: Take an auto or cab to Mehtab Bagh for a classic view of the Taj Mahal from across the Yamuna River.
itinerary.day2: 8:00 AM – 9:30 AM: Tomb of Akbar the Great (Sikandra)
itinerary.day3: Dinner & Leisure.

itinerary.day1: Transportation: From Taj Mahal, Mehtab Bagh is approx. 2-3 km (Auto: ₹150-170, Cab: ₹170-220, Bike: ₹70-80).
itinerary.day2: Start your day with a visit to the grand mausoleum of Emperor Akbar. It's a unique blend of architectural styles.

itinerary.day1: Explore this beautiful Mughal garden, which offers a serene and picturesque view of the Taj Mahal, especially ideal for photography.
itinerary.day2: Fees: ₹30 (Indians), ₹310 (Foreigners). On Fridays, ₹25 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners).

itinerary.day1: 11:30 AM – 1:00 PM: Agra Fort
itinerary.day2: Visit Mariam's Tomb nearby, the resting place of Emperor Akbar's wife, and then Chini Ka Rauza, known for its Persian-style glazed tile work.
itinerary.day3: Choose one major excursion for the day.

itinerary.day2: Transportation: From Sikandra area to Ram Bagh, approx. 6-7 km (Auto: ₹160-190, Cab: ₹190-230, Bike: ₹70-80).
itinerary.day3: 9:00 AM – 1:00 PM: Explore Chosen Destination

itinerary.day1: Take an auto or cab to this exquisite Mughal mausoleum, often called the "Baby Taj" due to its intricate marble inlay work.
itinerary.day3: Enjoy bird watching in this famous avifauna sanctuary, home to thousands of birds, especially migratory ones in winter. You can rent a rickshaw or explore on foot.

itinerary.day1: 2:30 PM – 4:00 PM: Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb (Baby Taj)
itinerary.day2: 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM: Lunch
itinerary.day3: Fees: ₹830/- per person.

itinerary.day1: Explore local markets or shops for famous Agra products.
itinerary.day2: Essentials: Wear modest clothes; follow temple rules; refrain from alcohol. Be mindful of ongoing construction.
itinerary.day3: If at Fatehpur Sikri: Local eateries outside the complex.

itinerary.day1: Recommendation: Visit Panchi Petha for traditional Petha sweets (₹200-₹500/kg) or Marble Handicraft Agra near Tajganj for intricate marble inlay work (₹500–₹50,000).
itinerary.day2: Fees: No entry fee.
itinerary.day3: If at Keoladeo National Park: Options available within Bharatpur.

itinerary.day1: Experience a theatrical presentation narrating the love story of Shah Jahan and Mumtaz.
itinerary.day2: 5:00 PM – 6:00 PM: Leisure / Return to Hotel
itinerary.day3: Fees: Varies, generally minimal or FREE for walking around outer areas.

itinerary.day1: Fees: ₹600–₹1200 depending on seating.
itinerary.day2: 6:00 PM onwards: Dinner & Leisure
itinerary.day3: Essentials: Wear modest clothing; follow temple rules. Most places shut between 12noon-4:40pm.

itinerary.day1: 7:30 PM onwards: Dinner
itinerary.day2: Enjoy a leisurely dinner at a highly-rated restaurant.
itinerary.day3: Fees: FREE for most temples.

itinerary.day1: Enjoy dinner at a restaurant of your choice.
itinerary.day2: Recommendation: For a themed experience, try Pind Balluchi Agra for Dal Makhani or Butter Chicken. For grill and street food, Sardar G Malai Chaap Junction is a good vegetarian option.

itinerary.day3: Return to Agra: Depending on your departure schedule, you can return to Agra.
Dinner & Departure: Enjoy a final meal in Agra before heading to your airport or station.
Agra Cantt Railway Station: 2.5km from Sadar Bazar.
Idgah Bus Stand: 2km from Sadar Bazar.

itinerary.day1: Agra 1-Day Trip Plan (Most Important Places)
itinerary.day2: Agra 2-Day Trip Plan (Next Most Important Places)
itinerary.day3: Agra 3-Day Trip Plan (Additional Important / Outskirts)

itinerary.day1: This plan covers the absolute must-see places in Agra, arranged in a time-efficient sequence for a fulfilling single-day visit, focusing on the iconic Mughal heritage.
itinerary.day2: If you have two days, you can expand on the core experiences of Day 1 by adding more historical sites and local cultural immersion.
itinerary.day3: This plan expands your Agra experience to include more distant but highly scenic and significant locations, enriching your journey.

itinerary.day1: 6:00 AM – 8:30 AM: Taj Mahal at Sunrise
itinerary.day2: Taj Mahal at Sunrise, Mehtab Bagh
itinerary.day3: Taj Mahal at Sunrise, Mehtab Bagh

itinerary.day1: 8:30 AM – 9:30 AM: Breakfast near Taj Mahal
itinerary.day2: Day 2: Historical Outskirts & Local Life (Next most important)
itinerary.day3: Day 2: (As per the 2-Day Plan above)

itinerary.day1: Fees: ₹25 (Indians), ₹300 (Foreigners).
itinerary.day2: 9:30 AM – 10:30 AM: Mariam’s Tomb & Chini Ka Rauza
itinerary.day3: 8:00 AM – 9:00 AM: Travel to Fatehpur Sikri / Keoladeo National Park

itinerary.day1: Fees: ₹50 (Indians), ₹650 (Foreigners). On Fridays, ₹40 (Indians), ₹600 (Foreigners).
itinerary.day2: Explore Ram Bagh, one of the oldest Mughal gardens in India, believed to be the first Mughal garden laid out by Babur.
itinerary.day3: Option B (Wildlife/Nature): Travel to Keoladeo National Park (Bharatpur). It's about 57 km from Agra.

itinerary.day1: Enjoy authentic Mughlai cuisine.
itinerary.day2: Activity: Take a Street Food Tour – Flavors of Agra (Evening is best, but can be done for brunch).
itinerary.day3: Essentials: Wear comfortable shoes; carry water. Consider a guide. Closed on Fridays.

itinerary.day1: Recommendation: Pinch of Spice (Fatehabad Road) offers excellent Butter Chicken (₹350) and Mutton Rogan Josh (₹400). Alternatively, Taj Mahal Restaurant for a fine dining experience (Multicuisine).
itinerary.day2: Recommendations: Try Bedai, Jalebi, Bhalla, Petha. For non-veg street food, visit Mama Chicken Mama Franky House for Galouti Kebabs and Frankies.
itinerary.day3: Fees: ₹50 (Indians), ₹610 (Foreigners). On Fridays, ₹40 (Indians), ₹600 (Foreigners).

itinerary.day1: 2:00 PM – 2:30 PM: Travel to Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb
itinerary.day2: Cost: ₹200–₹500 for food.
itinerary.day3: Option B: Keoladeo National Park

itinerary.day1: Marvel at the delicate pietra dura work, which predates the Taj Mahal and showcases early Mughal architectural brilliance.
itinerary.day2: Have lunch at a local eatery in Sadar Bazaar or try Ram Babu Paratha Bhandar for authentic Dhaba-style parathas (Aloo Paratha: ₹60).

itinerary.day1: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM: Shopping for Local Souvenirs
itinerary.day2: Visit Dayalbagh, a unique spiritual and architectural complex. The construction of the temple here is ongoing for over 100 years, showcasing intricate carvings.
itinerary.day3: 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM: Lunch

itinerary.day1: Head to your hotel for some relaxation.
itinerary.day2: Option B (Spiritual): Visit Mankameshwar Temple, an ancient Shiva temple believed to be from the time of Lord Krishna.
itinerary.day3: Fees: FREE.

itinerary.day1: Location: Kalakriti Cultural Center.
itinerary.day2: Time to relax or head back to your accommodation.
itinerary.day3: 3:30 PM – 6:00 PM: Further Exploration / Hidden Gem
Essentials: Be respectful of local customs.
Fees: FREE.
Connectivity:
Agra Airport: 5km from Sadar Bazar.
